bug.author: bradyz
bug.description:
Hi, I'm having import errors when i try to import torchvision. I'm using torchvision=0.4.0=py35_cu100 installed via conda (conda install torchvision -c pytorch). Minimal example: <denchmark-code>import torchvision import carla </denchmark-code>
Works, but <denchmark-code>import carla import torchvision
</denchmark-code>
hangs indefinitely

comments.comment: This is a bug. I have observed the same. The same also happens when importing torch before carla.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

Apparently it's not torchvision but torch itself: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12871137/75345412-99629400-5894-11ea-9ddf-002e99b5046c.png></denchmark-link>
Please make this clear in the docs!
I had the same issue using torchvision 0.5. I haven't tested 0.4. However, torchvision 0.2.1 works.

This should be fixed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla/commit/711738b1b91fc60325e693ed2a1d884f5b1fa6db>711738b</denchmark-link> . Also see <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/36034>pytorch/pytorch#36034</denchmark-link> .
Folks, have you tried this in 0.9.9? We solved it over there. I am closing this issue, but happy to reopen it if somebody finds problems again.
